intro: Chamaesyce marayensis, commonly known as the Maray River spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the genus Chamaesyce. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a rough texture, often with a waxy coating.
